articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Working Papers
Unintended Environmental Policies: The Impact of European Agricultural Subsidies on Pollution (Job Market Paper) [link]
(previously circulated as “An Empirical Model of Agricultural Subsidies with Environmental Externalities”)
Local Crop Diversity and Pest Diffusion: Evidence
from the Boll Weevil, joint with Marguerite Obolensky [link]
Costs of Climate Adaptation: Evidence from French Agriculture, joint with Jeffrey Shrader [link]
Work in Progress
The Worker’s Brain Under the Expert’s Hat: Occupation Coding, Tacit Knowledge, and Wage-Setting, joint with Suresh Naidu and Gina Markov

Tristan Emma Du Puy

            I am an economist doing research at the intersection of
            environmental economics and empirical industrial
            organization, with a focus on firm dynamics and relations
            between productivity and sustainability.
            I am currently doing a postdoc at the Columbia University
            Center for Political Economy, and will join the Sciences Po
            Department of Economics as an Assistant Professor in fall
            2026.
            I use they/them or she/her pronouns.

articles.title: Teaching
articles.contents:
Economic Development (TA), Spring 2025, Columbia University, Master in Economic Policy Management (SIPA), Prof. Eric Verhoogen
Mathematics for Economists (Tutor), Summer 2022, Columbia University, Master in Economic Policy Management (SIPA), Prof. Emanuele Gerratana
Climate Change Policy (TA), Spring 2021, Columbia University, Master in Environmental Science and Policy (SIPA), Prof. Scott Barrett
Macroeconomics I (TA), Fall 2020, Columbia University, Master in Economic Policy Management (SIPA), Prof. Tamrat Gashaw
Economics and Globalization (TA), Spring 2019, Sciences-Po Paris, Master in International Economic Policy (PSIA), Prof. Giorgio Barba Navaretti
